results.title: The Top end
results.creator_credit: Barbara Mariotti, New England Film Productions and SBS-TV
results.brief_description: Each story in this six part series illustrates different aspects of life in the Northerrn Territory by focusing on the experiences of individuals from various ethnic backgrounds.

results.title: Steeltown
results.creator_credit: Rex Tasker, Wolf Koenig, Walford Hewitson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A portrait of Hamilton, the Pittsburgh or Birmingham of Canada. This is a rich and colorful subject that encourages imaginative treatment on the screen. The heart of the city is the immense complex of furnaces and rolling mills, but nearby are the lake, the mountain, and the rich fruit farms. How the work of the steel mills touches the city and its surroundings is shown in many views during both day and night.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rex Tasker, Wolf Koenig, Walford Hewitson and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: 70mm cement splicer
results.brief_description:
70mm cement splicer
Richard Brown donation
Made from cast iron and the paint is noticeably flaking off. There is still film in the splicer. There is still a piece of blank film inside it.

results.title: M.2-16mm 2T splicer
results.brief_description:
The splicer, afterwards simply know as the “Catozzo”, was born as a result of a serious form of allergy to the smell of the cement suffered by his inventor which produced the happy intuition to use adhesive tape in its place, for joining the various film ends together.
This idea was subsequently consolidated and patented all over the world, developing into all the various currently existing models. [SOURCE: https://www.cir-srl.com/ last accessed 20/06/2019]

CIR (Costruzione Incollatrici Rapide) Catozzo

Incollatrice M. 2-16mm 2T splicer
with adhesive tape
housed in original cardbox box.

Housed in storage box stamped three times with:
Michael Hudson
Phone 387 4549
Film Production & design
626 Park Street
North Carlton VIC 3054

Included are: Instructions per film 16mm
description of splicers flier that folds out.
Made in Italy. Patented

Label at the bottom of the splicer has been attached which says:
Michael Hudson
Phone 387 4549
Film Production & design
626 Park Street
North Carlton VIC 3054

Inscribed at the base: Made in Italy. US pat

silver label at the base reads:
made in Italy by
Officine Meccaniche
Dr. Leo Catozzo
00050 Santa Severa (Roma)
Tel. 0766/78008-78181

FPB A-2025
